intro: Ardisia mayumbensis, commonly known as the Mayumbé ardisia, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many evergreen shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white or pale pink flowers. Its fruit is a bright red berry, which contains several small seeds. Ardisia mayumbensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
